Class Map

java.lang.Object
Map
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
Class to represent the game Map
Author:
George Paul

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Character[][] characterGrid
    2d array for storing the characters on the map.
    private Location[][] locationGrid
    2d array for storing the locations that make up the Map.
    private int mapWidth
    Width of the map.
    private int[] playerLocation
    Array to store the players coordinates so that this can be retrieved easily and not searched for each time they are needed.

    Constructor method.

  • Field Details

    • locationGrid

      private Location[][] locationGrid
      2d array for storing the locations that make up the Map.

    • characterGrid

      private Character[][] characterGrid
      2d array for storing the characters on the map.

    • playerLocation

      private int[] playerLocation
      Array to store the players coordinates so that this can be retrieved easily and not searched for each time they are needed.

    • mapWidth

      private int mapWidth
      Width of the map.

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      public Map​(int mapWidth, int noOfEnemies, int noOfAllies)
      Constructor method.
      Parameters:
      mapWidth - Width of the map
      noOfEnemies - Number of enemies to populate
      noOfAllies - Number of allies to poulate

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString​(boolean hasMap, boolean hasCompass)
      toString method with extra parameters so that map is printed differently depending on whether player has map and compass.
      Parameters:
      hasMap - Flag indicating user has a map
      hasCompass - Flag indicating user has a compass
      Returns:
      mapString String to represent the map

    • generateRandomMap

      private void generateRandomMap()
      Method to populate the location grid with locations.

    • generateCharacters

      private void generateCharacters​(int noOfEnemies, int noOfAllies)
      Method to populate character grid.
      Parameters:
      noOfEnemies -
      noOfAllies -

    • getPlayerLocation

      public int[] getPlayerLocation()
      Method to get the player coordinates
      Returns:
      playerLocation Returns coordinates as a length 2 array with first element being i and second being j.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Method to return the Player object.
      Returns:
      Player object.

    • setPlayerLocation

      public Character setPlayerLocation​(int i, int j) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Method to move the player object around the map
      Parameters:
      i - New i coordinate to move the player to.
      j - New j coordinate to move the player to.
      Returns:
      character If there was a character where the player moved to, return it to the main method.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - For when the edge of the map is reached.

    • generateItems

      public void generateItems()
      Method to generate Items and place them randomly on the map

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation()
      Method to return the Location object at the coordinates where the player is.
      Returns:
      Location

    • getLocationGridString

      public java.lang.String getLocationGridString()
      Method to generate a String to represent the locationGrid for saving the game state.
      Returns:
      locationGridString A single line String that represents the locationGrid.

    • getCharacterGridString

      public java.lang.String getCharacterGridString()
      Method to generate a String to represent the characterGrid for saving the game state.
      Returns:
      characterGridString A single line String that represents the characterGrid.

    • getInventoryString

      public java.lang.String getInventoryString()
      Method to generate a String to represent the inventories for saving the game state.
      Returns:
      inventoryString String that represents the inventories, each item is on its own line.

    • loadLocationGrid

      public void loadLocationGrid​(java.lang.String locationGridString) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to re-populate locationGrid based on a locationGridString
      Parameters:
      locationGridString - String that represents a locationGrid.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

      mapWidth -

      public void loadInventory​(java.lang.String inventoryString) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to re-populate inventories based on a inventoryString
      Parameters:
      inventoryString - String that represents a item in an inventory
